Great game to pass the time or play with friends. Fun to achievement hunt too!

Portal 2 is the sequel to Portal, one of the biggest surprises in gaming that basically came out of nowhere and got everyone hooked. Portal 2, on the other hand, was highly anticipated due to the success of the first game. And to a large extent, the game managed to deliver on the hype.

Portal 2 introduces some new puzzle elements, such as different gels which -depending on the color- give you high speed, bouncing, or ability to open portals on ‚Äúnon-white‚Äù (non-portal compatible) surfaces. These new additions add variety to the puzzles and manage to keep the game interesting while it lasts. That said, I have found Portal 2 not as memorable as the first game for several reasons.  Firstly, the story is not very interesting, and jokes are mostly not very funny. I have also found myself mostly annoyed by the new character, Wheatley. GLaDOS of the first game, for instance, was a much more interesting character / villain. Although there is a good variety of puzzles, they often feel too linear and easy, the reason being that there are very few white ‚Äúportal compatible‚Äù surfaces compared to the first game. Most of the time, once you spot the white area, you are halfway through solving the puzzle. And once you solve it, you don‚Äôt really feel smart. 

‚ÄúStill Alive‚Äù was one of the most memorable theme songs in video game history and although it would be unfair to expect a similar one from Portal 2, I should point out that the game lacks that ‚Äúmoment‚Äù the players experienced when they have beaten the first game.

Overall, Portal 2 is still a very good game and anyone who liked the original game should play it. That being said, lack of great characters makes it a less memorable game and you will stop caring about it after one playthrough, unless you jump to one of many well received mods, such as Portal Stories: Mel.

[b]Single Player Campaign:[/b] 7.5/10

At everything the single player campaign failed to impress me, the co-op campaign made up for it. I loved the creative and more challenging puzzle design and how you must act together with your friend to solve them. I know a few people who has played through the solo campaign and skipped the co-op part, assuming it is pretty much more of the same. Believe me, it isn‚Äôt. The co-op campaign is where Portal 2 truly shines. 

[b]Co-op Campaign:[/b] 8.5/10

[b]Overall: 8/10[/b]

Sin duda una obra maesta de el genero de puzzles.

Portal 2 se compone de 3 elementos que le hacen un juego espectacular:

1) El Singleplayer: Portal 2 como campa√±a es mas que solido, presentando una historia interesante y variedad de puzzles.

Sin duda lo mejor del juego es la manera en que poco a poco se nos presentan mecanicas nuevas, para luego mesclarzas y formar puzzles muy creativos; A menudo uno se pregunta "Y que hago aqui?", pero sin duda es gratificante el pasar un puzzle complejo, y ese es un sentimiento muy reccurrente a lo largo del juego.

Respecto a la Narrativa y Historia en si, es divertida la compa√±ia de GladOs pero Wathley se vuelve un poco pesado... recomiendo jugar el primer portal para entender mejor que pasa en aperture; Pero portal 2 es completamente disfrutable sin haber jugado el 1.

2) El Co-op: Adicionalmente a la extensa y divertida campa√±a singleplayer, portal 2 tambien cuenta con un co-op lleno de puzzles creativos, bromas de GladOs, y sobre todo, de risas y muertes con tu amigo de preferencia.

3) La workshop: Portal de por si tiene MUCHO contenido y una cantidad decente de rejugabilidad, pero para aquellos con ganas de mas, en la workshop se pueden encontrar miles de camaras de pruebas creadas por la comunidad, llenas de puzzles creativos y desafiantes son una experiencia completamente aparte de el juego principal, pero a la vez, muy refescante y divertido.



Un must-have para fanaticos del genero Puzzles.

Great mechanics, and great application of those mechanics. This is definitely a game that you can revist, and re-learn the levels, or better yet, see how fast you can do them. Portal 2's co-op is amazing, granted that you have someone that knows what they're doing. If you have a friend and are in a call with them, prepare for some frustration as you try to figure out what you're doing.
